1:
Why, Yahweh, do you stand far off?\q Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble?
\q
2:
Because of their arrogance, wicked people chase the oppressed;\q but please let the wicked be trapped by their own schemes that they have devised.
\q
3:
For the wicked person boasts of his deepest desires;\q he blesses the greedy and insults Yahweh.


\q
4:
The wicked man has a raised face; he does not seek God.\q He never thinks about God because he does not care at all about him.
\q
6:
He says in his heart," I will never fail;\q throughout all generations I will not meet adversity."
\q
7:
His mouth is full of cursing and deceptive, harmful words;\q his tongue injures and destroys.


\q
9:
He lurks in secret like a lion in the thicket;\q he lies in wait to catch the oppressed.
\q He catches the oppressed when he pulls in his net.
\q
10:
His victims are crushed and beaten down;\q they fall into his strong nets.


\q
11:
He says in his heart, "God has forgotten;\q he covers his face; he will not bother to look."
\q
12:
Arise, Yahweh! Lift up your hand, God!\q Do not forget the oppressed.


\q
13:
Why does the wicked man reject God\q and say in his heart, "You will not hold me accountable"?
\q
15:
Break the arm of the wicked and evil man.\q Make him account for his evil deeds,
\q which he thought you would not discover.
\q
16:
Yahweh is King forever and ever;\q the nations are driven out of his land.


\q
17:
Yahweh, you have heard the needs of the oppressed;\q you strengthen their heart, you listen to their prayer;
\q
18: You defend the fatherless and the oppressed\q so that no man on the earth will cause terror again.
